descriptionModule.briefSummary: A Prospective study on the performance and safety of the HeartStart OnSite (Model M5066A) \& HeartStart Home (Model M5068A) Defibrillator device data.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The objective of this PMCF (Post Market Clinical Follow-up) prospective collection of post-event data registry is to confirm the safety and performance as expressed in the energy delivery by the HeartStart HS1 Defibrillator (HeartStart OnSite and Home models in North America) in the population for the device's intended use in reference to its commercial labeling, and in relationship to the type of pads attached to the device.

armGroups.label: Suspected Sudden Cardiac Arrest
armGroups.description: All subjects with suspected of a circulatory arrest of any cause.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean shock energy delivered in the pediatric population
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean of shock energy delivered, when the pediatric defibrillation pads were attached to the AED as intended for infants and children under 25 kilograms / 55 pounds or 0-8 years old.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean shock energy delivered in the adult population
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean of shock energy delivered, when the adult defibrillation pads were attached to the AED as intended for in children and adults over 25 kilograms / 55 pounds or greater than 8 years old.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

primaryOutcomes.measure: The Patient Analysis System (PAS) shock advisory algorithm performance as determined by evaluation of the ECG as aligned with the device advisement.
primaryOutcomes.description: Performance is defined by the sensitivity and specificity; positive predictive value and false positive rate will be reported for each rhythm category (as defined by device labeling).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

primaryOutcomes.measure: Accurate detection of shockable rhythms and facilitation of shocks.
primaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of events where a shockable rhythm was identified by the device, the device advised a shock, and the device delivered a shock when the shock button was pressed.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

primaryOutcomes.description: Defibrillation success and the number of shocks required for success.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Frequency and severity of unexpected adverse events
secondaryOutcomes.description: Frequency and severity of unexpected adverse events
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement
Up to 15 minutes during device placement
Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Routine self-test performance/Battery Insertion self-test performance
secondaryOutcomes.description: Routine self-test performance/Battery Insertion self-test performance
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of events where the device advised a shock and the device armed.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Energy delivered consistent with device labeling
secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of defibrillations in which the energy delivered was consistent with device labeling.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of events in which pads were replaced at any time during the event after the user is prompted to do so by the device
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Shock button effectively pressed after shock advisement
secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of events where a shock was recommended by the device and the shock button was pressed.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Indicators of battery status/depletion (device logged data)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of events that include indicators of battery status/depletion (device logged data)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Aborted shocks because of low or high impedance
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of aborted shocks because of low or high impedance
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of events where CPR guidance was initiated (i-button pushed)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of events where CPR is performed during CPR guidance
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Have been suspected of a circulatory arrest for any cause.
* Have had HeartStart HS1 Defibrillator with electrodes:

Adult SMART Pads Cartridge \[REF: M5071A\], Infant/Child SMART Pads Cartridge (REF:M5072A) applied to their body and powered up with HS1 battery (Model M5070A), regardless of whether a defibrillation shock was delivered

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subjects will be excluded if any of the following are present:
* AED or pad use other than the HeartStart HS1 Defibrillator with above referenced Philips electrode pads. Note: Use of a device other than the Philips HeartStart HS1 AED does not preclude enrollment if the AED or an Advanced Life Support defibrillator was used after the HeartStart HS1 AED.
* AED used for training purposes.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Anyone who is suspected of having a sudden cardiac arrest.
